comments:
Using I20051123-1200, I cannot use the astview plugin in self-hosting if the plugin is part of the workbench plugins. It works only if the plugin is part of the target platform.
This used to work before the split of the runtime. Is it a consequence of this or simply a coincidence?
I get the following error when trying to open an ASTView.

The plugin appears in the list of plugins.

Here is the Manifest.MF corresponding to this plugin.
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-Name: %pluginName
Bundle-SymbolicName: org.eclipse.jdt.astview; singleton:=true
Bundle-Version: 1.0.5
Bundle-ClassPath: .
Bundle-Activator: org.eclipse.jdt.astview.ASTViewPlugin
Bundle-Vendor: %providerName
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.core.runtime,

Eclipse-LazyStart: true
Export-Package: org.eclipse.jdt.astview,
 org.eclipse.jdt.astview.views

Let me know if this is a setup issue or a regression?
Thanks.
go to plugins tab of the launch configuration that fails, press the Validate Plugin Set button, and report back what you see.
I got: No problems were detected in the selected set of plugins.
thanks.  This has no signs of being a PDE issue.  Moving to Equinox.

Tell us where you got the astviow plugin and how you imported the plugin into your workspace.

I downloaded the astview plugin version 1.0.6 from:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/jdt-ui-home/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.astview/org.eclipse.jdt.astview_1.0.6.zip

I then extracted this into my target eclipse and imported the plugin into my workspace with source folders.  The manifest in my workspace is the following:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
Bundle-Name: %pluginName
Bundle-SymbolicName: org.eclipse.jdt.astview; singleton:=true
Bundle-Version: 1.0.6
Bundle-ClassPath: ASTView.jar
Bundle-Activator: org.eclipse.jdt.astview.ASTViewPlugin
Bundle-Vendor: %providerName
Bundle-Localization: plugin
Export-Package: org.eclipse.jdt.astview;x-internal:=true,

Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.core.runtime,
 org.eclipse.ui.ide,

Eclipse-LazyStart: true


The thing I notice that is different is the Bundle-ClassPath value (yours had '.' and mine has ASTView.jar).  Can you try the same thing with the latest version of astview and see if the problem still exists.  If you still see the problem, please list the steps you used to reproduce.  Thanks.
closing as works for me.  Please re-open if you are still seeing problems with the latest ast view code and the latest Eclipse builds.  Thanks.
